title: Misty conditions expected during the morning
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa and Southern provinces during the afternoon or night today (14).

title: India gifts Furosemide injections to Sri Lanka following urgent request
byline: India has donated urgently-needed medicines to Sri Lanka responding to an urgent request from Colombo, the Indian High Commission said here on Thursday.

title: Russia seeks to exclude key Trump envoy from Ukraine talks, sources say
byline: Russian officials have communicated to their counterparts in the United States that they do not want Russia-Ukraine envoy Keith Kellogg involved in top-level discussions aimed at ending the Ukraine war, according to a U.S. official and another source with knowledge of the matter.

title: Ella-Wellawaya road blocked due to earthslip
byline: The Ella-Wellawaya road has been blocked near the 12th-kilometer post due to an earthslip triggered by adverse weather conditions, the police said.

title: Two sisters hacked to death in Muttur
byline: Two sisters aged 68 and 74 have been hacked to death at Dahanagar in Muttur, the police said.

title: Female Grama Niladharis withdraw from night shifts citing security concerns
byline: Sri Lanka Grama Niladhari Association has announced that all female Grama Niladharis will no longer work night shifts starting today (14), citing growing security concerns.

title: Holi 2025: India comes alive with the festival of colours
byline: Millions of Indians are celebrating Holi, the festival of colours.

title: ‘Batalanda’ Commission report to be presented to Parliament today
byline: Steps have been taken to present the ‘Batalanda’ Commission report to the Parliament today (14), the Department of Government Information announced.

title: Trains on coastal line delayed
byline: The Department of Railways announced that a train operating on the coastal line has encountered a technical fault near the Panadura railway station this morning (14), causing delays in the coastal line train operations.

title: ‘Buddha Rashmi Vesak Festival 2025’ to be held for 4-days in Colombo
byline: A discussion regarding the ‘Buddha Rashmi’ Vesak Festival 2025, jointly organized by the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple and the Prime Minister’s Office, was held at the Prime Minister’s Office under the patronage of the Secretary to the Prime Minister, Pradeep Saputhanthri.

title: Trump threatens retaliatory 200% tariff on European wine after EU proposes American whiskey tax
byline: President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened a 200% tariff on European wine, Champagne and spirits if the European Union goes forward with a planned tariff on American whiskey.

title: 12 taken to hospitals after American Airlines plane catches fire at Denver airport gate
byline: Twelve people were taken to hospitals after an American Airlines plane landed at Denver International Airport on Thursday and caught fire, prompting slides to be deployed so passengers could evacuate quickly.

title: Sri Lanka’s Pekoe Trail tops Times’ World’s Greatest Places of 2025 list
byline: Grab your suitcase and your passport — TIME has just released its list of the world’s 100 greatest places to visit in 2025.

title: ‘Batalanda’ Commission report tabled in Parliament: calls for justice, accountability
byline: The ‘Batalanda’ Commission report was presented to the Parliament this morning (14) by Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Ratnayake.

title: Parliament to debate ‘Batalanda’ Commission report, presidential committee to be appointed
byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Ratnayake said that steps will be taken to forward the ‘Batalanda’ Commission report to the Attorney General and appoint a Presidential Committee for necessary advice to proceed.

title: Live grenade recovered from A’pura sexual assault suspect’s house
byline: Police have recovered a live grenade from the house of the suspect arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital.
